Articles.Content:
my attempt at a p-51d, enjoy,

It flies, it turns, it lands. It's a p-51d.

(psoted this in the ww2 thread but i decided it needs a thread of its own)

Edited January 13, 2014 by Trollkowski
Outstanding!
I usually never check out modded stuff on here but the P-51 is one of my favorites. It does look good, perhaps a little to good.
NICE BROTHER!

My friends, I'm very proud of this person because he's one of my employees!

Great job mate!

I got to work with some vintage P-51Ds from WW2 during the middle of the summer and that look almost EXACTLY like the one I worked with, the only thing wrong is the color but that can't really be helped can it?

Edited December 4, 2013 by team.leit

This is AMAZING!

+rep
I like this! You did quite well with it.

I got to work with some vintage P-51Ds from WW2 during the middle of the summer and that look almost EXACTLY like the one I worked with, the only thing wrong is the color but that can't really be helped can it?

It can what colour scheme did you have in mind?

If you could post a picture or tell me trough a private message i can apply it to the plane and upload a few pictures!

It can what colour scheme did you have in mind?

If you could post a picture or tell me trough a private message i can apply it to the plane and upload a few pictures!

Unfortunately I do not have any photos from it , but the color scheme I was thinking is the metallic silver.

Such as.

and the person the red arrow is pointing to might be me

This was taken at Oshkosh, Wisconsin for the WWII Honor Flight during the EEA annual fly-in

metallic silver is probably a no go i'm afraid kerbpaint only supports matte colours at this moment so there isnt much i can do :/ Perhaps if i tone down the white a bit to make it look more metallic-ish, but it still wont be anywhere near the real deal. Cool picture though, i have great respect for ww2 pilots, no matter which side. There was just so much honor and respect when fighting back then, nowadays you fire at what your commanding officer tells you to fire at without a second thought, one push of a button is all it takes...

metallic silver is probably a no go i'm afraid kerbpaint only supports matte colours at this moment so there isnt much i can do :/ Perhaps if i tone down the white a bit to make it look more metallic-ish, but it still wont be anywhere near the real deal. Cool picture though, i have great respect for ww2 pilots, no matter which side. There was just so much honor and respect when fighting back then, nowadays you fire at what your commanding officer tells you to fire at without a second thought, one push of a button is all it takes...

Agreed I also have great respect for those who fought to give us what we have today. It's alright with the color, I kinda figured that the coloring wouldn't work

Also i must say, the activity and feedback on this thread is far bigger and better than that of my bf-109 thread, perhaps i didn't make it good enough? might have to go back to the drawing bord on that one! I really appreciate all the feedback i've been getting on this, keeps me motivated and makes me want to build bigger and better! thanks! (would also appreciate criticism as i like to learn from my mistakes). Going to keep working on this one though, might make the cockpit a bit longer in lenght as i've noticed it's not really to scale, could be a challenge though as i want to keep the cockpit view as unobstructed as possible

Also i must say, the activity and feedback on this thread is far bigger and better than that of my bf-109 thread, perhaps i didn't make it good enough? might have to go back to the drawing bord on that one! I really appreciate all the feedback i've been getting on this, keeps me motivated and makes me want to build bigger and better! thanks! (would also appreciate criticism as i like to learn from my mistakes). Going to keep working on this one though, might make the cockpit a bit longer in lenght as i've noticed it's not really to scale, could be a challenge though as i want to keep the cockpit view as unobstructed as possible

What can I say? People love the good old P-51 Keep up the good work!
You need to remake this ;-;

You need to remake this ;-;

Oh my, i still have the craft file for it (albeit a newer one than the one in the thread, made the fuselage slightly longer) but i really can't be arsed to remake this right now, might release the craft file and have someone else do it if they want to.
Very nice model...May I ask what dependencies there are for it? I presume you got that prop from the Firespitter mod?

Very nice model...May I ask what dependencies there are for it? I presume you got that prop from the Firespitter mod?

firespitter, pwing, infernal robotics and b9 for the landing gear.
Well done! Great looking aircraft!

Well done! Great looking aircraft!

Thank you!
Awesome! That would be a p51d-30 if I'm not mistaken.
